metadata.title: CVE-2021-28877 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the standard library in Rust before 1.51.0, the Zip implementation calls__iterator_get_unchecked() for the same index more than once when nested.This bug can lead to a memory safety violation due to an unmet safetyrequirement for the TrustedRandomAccess trait.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-28877` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libstd-rust-1.67 - 1.67.1+dfsg0ubuntu1-0ubuntu2
rust-all - 1.67.1+dfsg0ubuntu1-0ubuntu2
rust-clippy - 1.67.1+dfsg0ubuntu1-0ubuntu2
rust-gdb - 1.67.1+dfsg0ubuntu1-0ubuntu2
rust-lldb - 1.67.1+dfsg0ubuntu1-0ubuntu2
rust-src - 1.67.1+dfsg0ubuntu1-0ubuntu2
rustc - 1.67.1+dfsg0ubuntu1-0ubuntu2
rustfmt - 1.67.1+dfsg0ubuntu1-0ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: rustc package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.67.1+dfsg0ubuntu1-0ubuntu2').
